org.soulwing.sql

Class SQLTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.soulwing.sql.SQLTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SQLOperations

    public class SQLTemplate
extends Object
implements SQLOperations
    A thread-safe SQLOperations implementation.

    This class must be constructed with a DataSource that will be used as necessary to obtain connections to the database. 

     import javax.sql.DataSource;
 import org.soulwing.sql.SQLTemplate;

 DataSource dataSource = ...  // typically injected or retrieved via JNDI
 SQLTemplate sqlTemplate = new SQLTemplate(dataSource);
    A single instance of this class can be concurrently shared by an arbitrary number of application components.
    Author:
    Carl Harris

      • query

        public SQLQuery<Void> query()
        Creates a query operation.

        This is a synonym for SQLOperations.queryForType(Class) with Void as the specified type. A query obtained via this method is typically configured to use a ResultSetHandler to process returned rows.

        Specified by:
        query in interface SQLOperations
        Returns:
        query object that can be configured and executed to retrieve rows from the database

      • queryForType

        public <T> SQLQuery<T> queryForType(Class<T> type)
        Creates a query operation for objects of a given type.
        Specified by:
        queryForType in interface SQLOperations
        Parameters:
        type - subject type of the query
        Returns:
        a query that can be configured and executed to retreive rows from the database and return objects of type T.
